<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Angel of Vindication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3612) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Knights of Lastwall](/Sources.aspx?ID=123) pg. 80</row>

**Archetype** [Assassin](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=48)

**Prerequisites**
[Assassin Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1890)

**Access**
Knights of Lastwall have access to this feat.

**Requirements**
Your mark is an [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) creature.

</column>

---

To aid with your mission of destroying undead, you've specialized in techniques to destroy them, much as other assassins learn to kill the living. When you Strike a [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) undead foe with a weapon that has the [backstabber](/Traits.aspx?ID=172) weapon trait, you deal 3 extra precision damage instead of 1. If the weapon is a +3 weapon, you deal 6 extra precision damage instead of 2. If you have the [Angel of Death](/Feats.aspx?ID=1893) feat, your attacks also instantly destroy undead at 0 Hit Points, and attempts for the undead to rejuvenate—such as via a [lich's](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=68) _soul cage_ or a [ghost's](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=51) rejuvenation ability—fail unless the effect's [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) level is higher than half your level when you killed the creature (rounded up), or originates from an [artifact](/Traits.aspx?ID=253) or deity. Finally, if you have the [Assassinate](/Feats.aspx?ID=1894) feat and an undead mark critically fails its save against your Assassinate, it is destroyed.
